intro: Platylobium lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and lance-shaped, giving it its common name. It is a perennial herb that produces showy inflorescences during the warmer months.
